data.title: University of Louisville Athletic
data.meta_description: Greg Scruggs (6) DT - Louisville: Versatile defensive player who has played defensive tackle and defensive end... has added bulk to play inside... continues ...
data.text:
Louisville: Versatile defensive player who has played defensive tackle and defensive end... has added bulk to play inside... continues to learn the position... one of the team's leaders... missed the entire spring after having surgery.

2010: Appeared in 12 games, making six starts... finished the season with 14 tackles and two sacks... registered 5.5 tackles for loss... recorded two solo sacks for a combined 16 yards and a pass breakup against Rutgers ... also forced a fumble... recovered a fumble that led to a Louisville touchdown versus USF... had a breakout game as a starter versus Cincinnati, collecting three tackles, including one for a loss ... also recovered a fumble and had first career interception... had a season-high three tackles versus Memphis .

2009: Appeared in all 12 games and made 12 starts... totaled his best season with 24 total tackles and his first career sack... registered 6.5 tackles for loss... had one tacke for loss and one fumble recovery in win over Syracuse... recorded three tackles at West Virginia... finished with two tackles at Cincinnati... had three tackles at Connecticut... finished with two tackles against Southern Miss, including one for loss... had four tackles against Pittsburgh, including 1.5 for loss... finished with three tackles at Utah, including one for loss... started but did not register a tackle against Kentucky... had two tackles in Cards' win over Indiana State.

2008: Appeared in nine games as a true freshman... made three starts, including first collegiate start versus Syracuse... recorded four total tackles.

St. Xavier High School: Played for Steve Specht at St. Xavier High School... played for the nation's top-ranked team... led St. Xavier to a perfect 15-0 record and a state championship win over Mentor, 27-0... started all 15 games at defensive end... played just one season of football for St. Xavier, recording 57 tackles, nine sacks, two forced fumbles and three fumble recoveries... registered 51 quarterback pressures... earned second team All-GCL honors... selected Honorable Mention All-Cincinnati... selected to play in the North-South All-Star Game... three-star prospect by Rivals.com and Scout.com... ranked as the 56th-best defensive end by Scout.com... performed three seasons in the marching band... played on the basketball team for all four years... averaged 7.0 points and 3.0 rebounds on the hardwood.

Personal: Son of Anita Felton... born 8/17/90...sociology major.
